page.title: 05Tockwith Commuting Patterns.
page.content: { Job Survey 1.} This survey was conducted to find out where heads of households work. From our survey we found out that: 10% work locally (i.e. in villages or on farms in our block) 26% work within a 10 mile radius. 50% work in towns (i.e. more than 10 miles away in York, Leeds, Harrogate or Wakefield.) 14% travel all over the U.K. We deduced that Tockwith, Bilton and Bickerton are basically commuter villages with most people travelling out to work. The average journey per day to and from work is 55 miles. The greatest daily distance is 150 miles, and the smallest is half a mile. One exception can travel between 100 and 10 000 miles daily, worldwide, by air! Most travel by company or private car.
